sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Alyssa Harper is being referred for further evaluation and management of persistent, unexplained fatigue and joint pain that has not improved despite initial treatment.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports a six-month history of ongoing fatigue, generalized joint aches (primarily in the wrists and knees), and occasional low-grade fevers. She denies recent infections, significant weight loss, or rashes. There is no family history of autoimmune disease.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No known chronic illnesses. No previous surgeries. No history of allergies.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Currently taking acetaminophen as needed for pain. No other regular medications.

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: Vital signs stable. Mild tenderness noted in wrists and knees, no visible swelling or erythema. No lymphadenopathy. Cardiovascular, respiratory, and abdominal exams were unremarkable.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Initial blood work showed mild anemia (Hb 11.1 g/dL), elevated ESR (34 mm/hr), and normal renal and liver function tests. ANA and rheumatoid factor pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of her symptoms and abnormal laboratory findings, I am referring Ms. Harper to your service for further assessment, including consideration of autoimmune or rheumatological conditions. Thank you for your expert evaluation.
